news.summary: Families seeking help for their childrenâ€™s complex needs describe threats of police action against them.

news.title: Women traumatised by breast cancer treatment at NHS trust, BBC told
news.summary: More than 200 patients suffered harm, including unnecessary mastectomies, the BBC has been told.

news.title: Labour drops plan to give workers protection from unfair dismissal from first day in a job
news.summary: Employees will instead get the right after six months - the promise was a key pledge in the party's manifesto ahead of last year's general election.

news.title: National Guard member dies after shooting in Washington DC
news.summary: Sarah Beckstrom, 20, succumbed to her injuries, while a second guardsman remains in critical condition, Donald Trump says.

news.title: Badenoch defends calling chancellor 'spineless' in Budget row
news.summary: The Conservative Party leader says she was "channelling" public anger when she accused the chancellor of "whining about mansplaining".

news.title: Ex-Brexit Party MEP named in Nathan Gill messages denies taking pro-Russian payments
news.summary: A prominent former MEP for Nigel Farage's old party denies taking bribes in a pro-Russian campaign.

news.title: At 15 my best friend promised she'd have my baby. Now I'm a mum
news.summary: Georgia and Daisy's childhood closeness later become the foundation for a life-changing act of generosity.

news.title: Louvre to hike ticket prices for most non-EU tourists by 45%
news.summary: The price increase is expected to raise millions to fund the museum's renovation plans.

news.title: We met on TV's Blind Date - we're still married after 34 years
news.summary: Sue and Alex Tatham became the first couple who met on Blind Date to get married. They reflect on a life together 40 years after the show first broadcast.

news.title: 25 Oscar-tipped films, and how to watch them
news.summary: Hamnet, Avatar and Marty Supreme will face one battle after another as the awards race heats up.
